TopicTitle: places to visit in our solar system

Articles.Content:
I just have found another one for me.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mars_monolith

That seems harmless!

Seriously though, I've never heard of this on Mars. That is a pretty cool geologic feature! Strange! I wonder what it looks like on the surface.
maybe once you get close you can pick up a SSTv signal

And there's the Phobos monolith!!

Maybe a failed project of life on Mars!!!

And there's the Phobos monolith!!

The phobos monolith doesn't even look that odd though, it just freaked out people that don't know what 'monolith' means in geology. It's like claiming aliens have visited earth because of Uluru.
The Mars monolith is also pretty unimpressive when you view it from above. It does have a rectangular shape to it from one side but the back is oblong and typical of any other boulder.

It's like claiming aliens have visited earth because of Uluru.

Countless tourists visit Australia because of it - but maybe aliens are a bit more sensitive towards indigenous people?
